website_summaries.verdict: Perfect for motor homes, jet skis, lawn tractors, and generators.
pros: 15-amp bench battery charger maintains and charges any AGM, GEL, or WET automotive or marine 12-volt battery
Fully automatic high frequency charging delivers three-stage charging, automatically switching from fast charge, to top-off, to trickle charge
40-amp engine start helps start your vehicle in about 90 seconds
LCD screen displays charging status and battery status with easy to understand icons
Patented alternator check indicates whether alternator is maintaining battery level
ETL Certified for performance and safety
cons: Customers don't recommend using with AGM batteries
Some units go dead early in their life without warning

customer_reviews.title: Good ridence...
customer_reviews.text: Bought two - one for me and one for my dad. He didn't use his for the first 6 months (couldn't let go of his ancient one) and I rarely used mine because it rarely worked. I'd hook it up and press charge and about 75% of the time the stupid thing would show my dead battery as 100% charged and switch to maintain mode. Dad reported the same thing and eventually threw his out. So finally today I hook it up to "Ol' Blue" and the POS gave up on its own miserable existence and offed itself. Good ridence.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your $$$!!!
customer_reviews.text: Apparently Black and Decker has lost all concern for quality and customer satisfaction. Instead, all their effort is on manufacturing an impressive front. My unit worked (used 3 times at most) just long enough to be past 30 day warranty. Now it lights up but has no output. Amazon has cleverly avoided any option for Chat, Customer Complaints or other interaction once an item is out of warranty. What a waste of $60 plus it failed when I really needed it! I wish I could give B & D plus Amazon 0 stars for this order!
customer_reviews.author: R. B. Trembly

customer_reviews.title: Wasted Money 💰😡
customer_reviews.text: Too complex to be functional. Instead of charging a dead battery it says "FLO" indicating a full battery, and "Float Mode" to maintain the full battery. But the battery is DEAD. The Battery Recondition feature is nice, The Alternator test is nice. But give me a Battery CHARGER the just charges a battery!!!. UPDATE: Today I tried it again. DEAD battery, pluggd in, connected.......I doesn't even SEE the battery. I HATE THIS DUMB THING! WISH I COULD GET MY WASTED MONEY BACK! Fall of 2019. One last attempt. Dead battery on my camper. Same stupid problem. "FLO" Smashed the unit into dust. Hooked up a 1966 Sears battery charger, and charged the dead battery.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Britton

customer_reviews.title: Be careful
customer_reviews.text: Charger went to FLO setting every time, which is a float charge. Tried on several batteries that were not charged up. Left one battery on FLO overnight and it did not charge up. Other charger I have works on same batteries, so they are fine. I saw a few other reviews mention same issues. Seems like there are a few duds out there, so you are taking your chance on ordering. I wouldn't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Not good for agm batteries
customer_reviews.text: I tried this charger on two different Optima spiral agm batteries. Both times, the charger tried to cook them. I've never seen an Optima battery get that hot before. The first battery I noticed that the charger was ramping up as it neared 80% , when it should've been lowering the amperage and I was able to catch it before it reached meltdown .The second one I was not so lucky , it was actually whistling from venting gasses. This charger also has no manual trickle charge option which is ridiculous. The technology in this battery charger is not up to snuff for expensive modern batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Useless probably dangerous too
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this and I should have read these other One Star reviews first. Surprise, it DOESN'T work. Same problem as everyone else here, goes straight to Float and shows 13.3 Volts even though the battery actually only has 10.7 Volts (according to my multi-meters). Who knows what is really going on inside this high voltage/amperage mystery box? The manufacturer always gives a stock form letter answer to explain their dangerously defective products. This charger is a known piece of garbage. My advice, throw the thing away before it burns your house down and don't buy any more B&D products. This product is a lawsuit just waiting to happen.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey A. Grimm

customer_reviews.title: Junk - don't bother.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this at the end of July. Needed today for the first time, September 4th. Found out that it will NOT charge a dead battery - It HAS to have some charge for it to work. And that tidbit of information is at the very end of the instructions, in small print. Strike one. I put jumper cables on the battery from another car. It IMMEDIATELY started charging. Then strike 2 - it's sitting under the hood and now, after 7 minutes, shows that it is "Overheated" and WILL NOT CHARGE! I called tech support and waited almost 30 minutes on "musical" hold and they didn't pick up. And I'm out of the return window. Buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Dan LoPresto

customer_reviews.title: This unit conked out after six months. It won't ...
customer_reviews.text: This unit conked out after six months. It won't power up and now I have to pay to ship it to be repaired or replaced. I'm stuck with it now - if I were buying again I'd look for something more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: A. Mcminn

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time
customer_reviews.text: I should have listened to all the one star reviews, because my experience was similar. I have a dead battery that was tested just a few days ago as good. Like others said, it shows the battery at 75 percent full then goes into float mode within a few seconds. The engine start feature does the same thing, goes right into float mode. I made sure to read the instructions to ensure I wasn't being an idiot. It does mention that if the battery is below a particular voltage that it won't charge but I confirmed that mine was above that level. Thank goodness Amazon makes returns easy, it's one of the reasons I took a chance on this.
customer_reviews.author: Corey&Lauren

customer_reviews.title: NOW it sits in a box.  A REMINDER  of what NOT to buy. Black & Decker HAS NO warranty Support.
customer_reviews.text: Being disabled I find I wasted money that i can not afford to. Charger made a lot of noise but worked fine for a while, it finally quit just before the warranty ran out and B & D has not returned any of my emails asking them what to do about getting mine repaired. I finally traced the problem to the circuit board but i is beyond my expertise, so now it sits in a box. A Reminder of what not to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Hyspeed

customer_reviews.title: Smoke coming from the unit after 10 minutes of use, then it dies...
customer_reviews.text: Unit died on me after 10 minutes of charging my car battery. At first it was working just fine, about after about 10 minutes it started to go on / off, beeping and then smoke started to come from the unit. I returned it to Amazon, I don't want to risk messing up my car electronics wiht this.
customer_reviews.author: m.a.g

customer_reviews.title: Not functional
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to have a battery charger / jump starter for the coming winter. I have a brand new car but I wanted to test the charger and learn how it functions. I placed the charger cables on the brand new battery on our car and it read 7.5 volts after disconnecting it from the car. 8 hours later it was still charging so there must be something wrong with the charger and I'm sending it back. I will purchase another charger but different manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Islanders Man

customer_reviews.title: Would not jump start jeep
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this based on reviews on amazon. I sent it right back the next day. I had a weak jeep battery and when I hook this to the battery it would not even jump start it. The charger kept reading the battery was full. I used a small jump pack and the vehicle started right away. I also hooked up my old school charger and it worked great. I would not recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: This charger does everything!
customer_reviews.text: I love the size, the look of this charger, all the different options available. Who ever heard of reconditioning your battery using electrical pulses to restore a battery? And it does it automatically, after it's done it tells you. It has a 40A car starter mode, it tests the alternator, checks the voltage of the battery and current as well. What's not to like.
customer_reviews.author: Lyn

customer_reviews.title: Burned up 6 months after the 1 year warranty expired.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit in October 2017. I had a little luck with the recondition function on one battery, but not on the second battery I used it on. Today April 7, 2019, I was using it to charge the battery on my car after my wife left the car lights on killing the battery. The charger brought it from 25% to 50% charged and the charger burned up. It filled my garage with toxic smoke before I could unplug it and bring it outside. Do not by this POS!
customer_reviews.author: David P.

customer_reviews.title: I finally See the light!!!
customer_reviews.text: The last couple batteries I have connected to this have all registered as being full, and I finally realized that the problem wasn't with my tractor or car, but with the charger. After spending much time trying to find the problem elsewhere, I finally realized after checking the batter with a meter that I have a crap charger, and when I think back - it hasn't really been working right all along.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Feature-rich Charger
customer_reviews.text: The Black & Decker charger is a nice unit, lightweight and compact. I bought it to replace a much older charger that finally died. I was impressed by all the technological advances provided. It also has a unique cord & clamp storage system, wrapping around the case, which keeps the cords orderly. My only misgiving is that it's awkward to get the cords wrapped into place, otherwise, a fine device.
customer_reviews.author: Reginald X.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I ordered and needed
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this as my batter was dead. Thought I needed a new alternator as well. Was hoping I could jump the batery, take it in to the shop and get the alternator fixed. Found out that the battery was completely dead with this thing. Took that back, got a partial refund and new battery, replaced it and then checked the Alternator with this and alternator was fine. So did what I needed. Glad to have it around the house for possible issues in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Christian A Kolb

customer_reviews.title: Compact size makes storing easy
customer_reviews.text: Some of the other reviews said they had issues with the charger but I have had no problems with it at all. Since lockdown and work from home, my car battery has died several times because I have not been driving it. I was borrowing my dad's BLACK+DECKER but it was an older larger model and awkward to store because it was tall with a big handle. This unit fits on the shelf easily and is easy to move when needed. It charged my battery up from almost dead in a few hours and then went into trickle charge mode to keep the battery charged.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Excellent charging, Automatic shutoff and battery reconditioning
customer_reviews.text: If your battery is low it will start off with 15 amps for a faster charge, but will taper down to one or two amps toward the end of the charging cycle. After charging a battery I always use the battery conditioning cycle, which seems to make all my batteries last well beyond the warranty period. I have gotten over 5 years from some of my batteries using this charger. I recently bought a second one in case this 5 year old charger ever fails. Yes it automatically shuts off when the battery is fully charged.
customer_reviews.author: Bud Mckechnie

customer_reviews.title: Does not work at all
customer_reviews.text: I did not need to use the charger for 6 month so I am stuck with it. It turns on and registers voltage but does not charge. I have tried it on 3 different 12V batteries of various starting voltage and it did not charge any of them at all. It shows on the read out that is charging 15 amps but the battery voltage never increases. Not even a little. And I am stuck with it. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Jarret

customer_reviews.title: not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Several things. This unit will not charge a dead battery that shows below 2 volts. I had to use my 2 amp trickle charger to get this unit to charge that battery. After several hours the unit was still showing puzzling voltage numbers. The trickle charger bailed me out. The unit is also unwieldy. It's off balance, hard to place on a surface without it tipping. Cord storage is just as messy. It looks nice but I haven't really been able to use it. I tried to connect some electrolysis stuff to remove rust, but alas this charger won't show a connection because its not connected to a battery. What am I supposed to used this thing for???????
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about 4 months now and it's worked great so far. It's pretty much automatic. I did have one battery that was long dead that no other charger could do anything with it. This unit didn't bring it back from the dead but it did get it up to 13 volts when no other charger could. The battery wouldn't hold that charge but that's not the chargers fault. I keep this plugged into batteries that do a lot of sitting. I need to buy two more so I don't have to keep swapping it out every month.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Speck

customer_reviews.title: Beware -  Has an important quirk
customer_reviews.text: I got this to charge up the battery in my wife's car when she leaves her dome light on and drains the battery. Sometimes she leaves it for days and the battery is stone cold dead. Unfortunately, this unit does not recognize a dead battery and won't charge it. So what I do is hook up my 1.25 amp charger that I use for my motorcycle and let it run for a few hours. Then the Black and Decker charger will recognize the battery and charge it normally. Kind of annoying, I think!
customer_reviews.author: Mike in PDX

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, but smart.
customer_reviews.text: Much lighter than the old style chargers I have owned over the years. This unit has some serious smarts. I tried to use it on a battery that was "dead" (under 10 volts) and it did complain. Wanted to re-condition the battery and not start charging. That was annoying. What I found was all I needed to do was use the engine start mode to get the battery voltage up a bit and then I could use the charge mode and then it did a great job. Hope it lasts, like the light weight and info panel with voltage meter.
customer_reviews.author: David Seeman

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Brought 3 of my car batteries back to life! All three different sizes. One dead for a month, one that’s been dead for 6 months, and miraculously it brought back a battery that had been dead since the “San Antonio gas shortage” 2015!!! I cannot express how much this thing kicks butt. Only thing I noticed was that if you’re reviving a literal dead battery like I was, you’ll need to jump the battery first to get it above I think 3v, otherwise the charger will not be able to charge it. Just hooked them up to my running daily via jumper cables for 15min and then slapped the charger on em and they were and are now golden af.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NFG
customer_reviews.text: Have bought 3. One was good, still use it. Two was DOA, straight back to Amazon. Three worked fine for 2 years then I hooked the battery up backwards and it burned out, now dead. I won't buy another just because it is so very easy to put a $0.15 diode in series, they deserve to go the same route as GM. Guess I'll have to go back to Shumacher, which I gave up on a few years back, a number of them wouldn't maintain at a proper voltage.
customer_reviews.author: Bob White

customer_reviews.title: The next day I disconnected it and the truck started right up and has been perfect since. I highly recommend this charger not on
customer_reviews.text: My dealership told me my battery was shot in my truck and it needed to be replaced. I read online about the ability to "de-sulfate" a poorly functioning Optima battery. I bought this charger because it had a recondition feature which basically pulses the battery to help loosen up the sulfur on the plates inside. I hooked it up per the instructions and let it recondition over night. The next day I disconnected it and the truck started right up and has been perfect since. I highly recommend this charger not only for that feature but also because of its jump-start feature as well.
customer_reviews.author: AMP

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic! But the recondition cycle is pretty long though ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a third car I don't drive much and it just sits in the garage. So I figured the battery needs to be maintained before it's completely drained. Not only this battery charger can jump start a car but also reconditions the battery. I tried it on a 4-year-old battery and then charged it again. It held about 90% of the charge. Fantastic! But the recondition cycle is pretty long though (e.g. 24 hours).
customer_reviews.author: Adam Pan

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work, no support bait and switch
customer_reviews.text: Followed instructions to the letter, hooked up, didn't work. Called tech support three times, waited on hold for 15-20 mins each time, then hung up. Never talked to support. Tried website, no joy on support their either. Page just keep loading forever. This is just a company that bought the Black and Decker name to use their reputation to sell an inferior product. Just a bait and switch.
customer_reviews.author: scrivner

customer_reviews.title: Good value and many features.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. The charger has a lot of features and has saved two batteries that were considered dead prior to this charger and it has already paid itself off getting batteries to work in my multiple vehicles that my old charger wouldn’t charge. One trick I found to get it to charge them was use the start button to force the dead battery voltage high enough and then start the charging cycle.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett A. Hardy

customer_reviews.title: UNSAFE CHARGER
customer_reviews.text: I used this battery charger on a battery that was a few years old, and tried to use the battery recondition function. I went back in the garage a few hours later and it was sending 16-17amps to the battery and had started to stink up the house with poisonous H2S gas. The battery seemed to be very close to exploding.
customer_reviews.author: denise

customer_reviews.title: Very good product!!!
customer_reviews.text: Told me how low my battery was after a long winter of not driving my ride and before I could finish reading the first page of the manual, my car started right up. Thank you! I like the maintaining feature that charges the battery as needed when put up for the winter.
customer_reviews.author: mickey karnes

customer_reviews.title: Wish to relate a malfunctioning unit please???
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit months ago to replace my old one. Ironically I did not have to use it until today. Took it out of box. Hooked it up (correctly) pushed charge and about 30 seconds later it started to smoke. Turned off and unhooked. Return date passed in Feb but is there any chance I might be able to return it for another unit??? Thank You cheers John
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy - Junk - stopped working after first use - and replacement didn't work at all.
customer_reviews.text: The first time I tried to use it was ok. The second time it was dead - plugged it into outlet and nothing happened. Unfortunately, this occurred three days after Amazon's return date. They sent me a replacement since the warranty was still in effect, and that one didn't work at all. I have requested a refund and have not heard back.
customer_reviews.author: DWolf

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to charge batteries in my cars and boats. After one charge, the unit starting giving trouble and a dead battery would read fully charged. Can't be trusted, cuts off on trickle charging and gives false reading that you're charged when you're not. Bought another brand and haven't had any issues.
customer_reviews.author: NITEBLITZ

customer_reviews.title: Too Low, Too Bad
customer_reviews.text: The charger is great but I gave it a 2-star because the battery to be connected MUST have at least 2 volts or the charger will not turn on. This means that DEAD batteries cannot be resurrected with this charger. Had I read deeper into the info, I would not have bought this model. Oh, sure, it will be useful for weak batteries, but what good is a battery reconditioning option if there is a voltage cutoff. Jumper cables would be just as useful ...and cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy S.

customer_reviews.title: Followed all the instructions. Connected it to a new ...
customer_reviews.text: Followed all the instructions. Connected it to a new battery that had recently been discharged due my leaving acc ignition switch on. Charger indicated the battery was fully charged and would not charge.
customer_reviews.author: Sham

customer_reviews.title: Worked great while it worked...
customer_reviews.text: Bought the end of June. When needed in end of October unit won't recognize it's connected to battery. Have tried several times to no avail.
customer_reviews.author: Big D

customer_reviews.title: Good unit but check condition
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended. You might have to play around with it. For instance, I had to do a trickle charge first, then the charge for my battery to work. Not sure if it was the condition of the battery or the unit itself. One more thing to note, I was sent a used unit had finger prints and that distinct small shop scent that well all have come to love. although I paid for a new one, was sent a used one. Why I didn’t return it? I needed it right then and there. Not the first time this happened to me ordering through amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Make it right if you care.
customer_reviews.text: Work for 1 month used about 15 hours. Purchase july 29 2019 Stop working October 12 2019 Not to happy with service pay to sent your charge back $ 22.00
customer_reviews.author: theodore martin

customer_reviews.title: Fine for maintaining, not emergencies or dead batteries
customer_reviews.text: If your battery is dead or has less than 2v charge, this will do nothing at all. I mean nothing. You will get flashing lights and a needed reference to the manual where you'll find this out. This was pretty disappointing as we had a car with an entirely dead battery. Thankfully my ever patient neighbor let us borrow a trickle charger that got it past the mark.
customer_reviews.author: Holland

customer_reviews.title: the screen just flashes like the terminals aren't connected even when they are
customer_reviews.text: Dead on arrival. Tried everything to get it to work, the screen just flashes like the terminals aren't connected even when they are. Unplugged the unit let it reset and tried again, but nothing. Very disappointed. I live in California, and tried calling company and got a message that they are closed, good bye, click!! Not able to leave a message and now have to wait till tomorrow to call them when I won't be home and won't have the unit with me and can't try to troubleshoot. Brand new item appears to be a piece of junk and it's not cheap either.
customer_reviews.author: RockyS

customer_reviews.title: Some issues with float "FLO" charging mode
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used the charger, it worked fine. Next time around, the charger started going into Float "FLO" mode even though the battery was not fully charged. I had made the connections with red point connected to battery and black one connected to engine block/chassis as per the instructions in the manual. I found that when it started going in float "FLO" mode, if I connected both red/black points directly to the battery, it started charging correctly. I am mentioning this because I see many people running into the same problem of the charger going into float mode even though the battery is not charged.
customer_reviews.author: Nik

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Really good product. Seems really rugged, simple, and it's easy to use. I really like the maintenance feature which decrystallizes (I forget the actual term sorry) the cells in the battery. I've brought back two out of three batteries that tested no good.
customer_reviews.author: Glen S.

customer_reviews.title: At first it worked like a dream
customer_reviews.text: At first it worked like a dream, but then I realized it would continue charging fully charged batteries at full power rather than go to float if you didn't restart it every now and then. After a few months it failed to register batteries that weren't at least 50% charged. Since it's electronically controlled it's basically a paper weight if it doesn't sense it is connected to a battery.
customer_reviews.author: George P. Hranowskyj

customer_reviews.title: Features beyond its price point
customer_reviews.text: It worked well and is a great tool to have on hand, even though it was unable to save my wife's care battery (which was super old and this was a last ditch effort). There are a lot of features on this unit that are only found on higher priced models, which is wonderful. Just please READ THE INSTRUCTIONS before using.
customer_reviews.author: Brett J.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT...... but........
customer_reviews.text: Light yet rugged and has a BATTERY RECONDITION feature I didn't even know about. Excellent value. UPDATE! All the features seem to work EXCEPT the battery charge feature. Since I received the unit I've tried to charge at least 5 batteries and it always says that the battery is fully charged when I KNOW that it isn't. I wish I had returned the charger for another. If you order one please test the battery charging feature as soon as possible.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Inzinna

customer_reviews.title: Love It. Its light compact and intelligent
customer_reviews.text: Love It. Its light compact and intelligent! 15 amp charge rate is great and it has a start/crank function at 50 amps for 90 seconds. Also, has an alternator test function and a battery re-conditioner function. It definitely is worth the price and with free shipping for Prime members, its a steal. I am an amateur mechanic and an Electronic technician by trade, I was really quite impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Vatek1

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Charger for the Money
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it yet, but just the heavy duty rubber casing surrounding the charger, in addition to the built in cable holders and the simple to read display makes this well worth the money ! I'll come back and update after I use it. I bought it for full time RV life, and to help keep our extra house batteries topped off when not using them !
customer_reviews.author: jamie

customer_reviews.title: TOTAL JUNK !!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked once or twice now just goes into FLO mode. Looks nice but TOTAL JUNK !!! No more fancy looking chargers for me, I'm going back to old fashioned ones that last twenty years and still going.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie H.L

customer_reviews.title: Resurrected an old battery
customer_reviews.text: Checked lots of reviews and this one ranked well. Good feature set and performance. I tried the reconditioning on an old RV battery that had been sitting in the floor for about 3 years (it would not charge) and after a 24 hr reconditioning it charged up to 12.8V. Very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Kukachka

customer_reviews.title: failed after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Didn't like all the electronic functions because there's no way this thing can test the alternator and supply enough power to start a car anyway so why pretend, after 2 years of light usage it would not even light up when connected to a battery, I tried several different battery's even a new one, probably not worth buying
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: If I could rate zero stars, I would.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I got in exchange for the first, because the first one would show that I didn't make battery connection, therefore wouldn't charge. The second one doesn't even turn on, so yeah, I'm ticked especially after accidentally allowed my "return time limit" to laps before trying it out. So not pleased to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Magda

customer_reviews.title: From customer negative reviews to my observation
customer_reviews.text: I just used it to start my motorcycle battery charging and that seemed to work fine, use the alternator check and it worked fine, used the 90 second 40 amp JumpStart and it worked fine, I charge my battery and it stepped down from 13.1 amps to .9 fine, after 1 hour showed battery power at 14.7 and holding at 14.2 with battery charger disconnected, we shall see what the future has in store, so far so good
customer_reviews.author: T.W.M.

customer_reviews.title: Does not work very well.
customer_reviews.text: Works great Update 8/6/2020 Product stop working. Will not charge. Also will not charge most batteries if voltage is low. Would have to do a quick charge like if I'm starting a car a few times then let it charge. Then some times it still wouldn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny (Juan) Velasquez

customer_reviews.title: I almost gave up on it.
customer_reviews.text: I had the same issue other reviewers had with the issue of having a completely dead battery and it wouldn't charge. Mine did the same thing and would only go into Flo mode. I then used the battery reconditioning function and went back in a couple of of hours and on a whim hit the charger button. Started charging and worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: WILL

customer_reviews.title: Decent charger
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 of these to use in a boat repair shop. They appear to work okay. As I had seen in other reviews, this charger doesn’t seem to charge dead batteries. It does okay on those that haven’t been fully discharged.
customer_reviews.author: Dockguy

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift for my husband. I really wasn't sure what to look for when my husband needed to replace a non-working battery charger as I had only seen and used ancient ones. This one is amazing! I chose it over others based on the Black and Decker name and the other positive reviews. My husband loves it and wonders why he hadn't replaced the old one long ago.
customer_reviews.author: Giggly1

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Trash
customer_reviews.text: It was sold as 12 volt battery charger and it really don’t charge 12 volt arc or tractor battery it keep showing it’s not plugged. Piece of trash
customer_reviews.author: omer

customer_reviews.title: Not in manufacturer box!
customer_reviews.text: I received mine in a brown box, not the manufacturer box. Where is the manufacturer box? Is this reconditioned. The product may be great, but if I’m paying full price, I expect a new product.
customer_reviews.author: LUVLEE17

customer_reviews.title: Cables blinks on New & Old batteries
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if it's just mine but I got a bad one, re ordering a new one through customer service. Tried it on old batteries and new ones, straight Nothing. Just kept blinking as if the cables couldn't find anything.
customer_reviews.author: That Guy Dave

customer_reviews.title: Not great quality + no support (at least that was my experience).
customer_reviews.text: The display for some reasons does not properly work when I need it. I've tried to contact the support - no luck. Managed to make it working again (by disassembling it and resembling it). [5/23/2020] - Still working, after second time to tear it to pieces I decided to buy a new display from eBay. Some of the segments are off but they start to work after several hours of charging - strange ;)
customer_reviews.author: Mr. T

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: does a good job on car battery, but like everyone says the battery to be charged must have a little charge to it, I had to jump my dead battery with another car battery then the charger worked great
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Also has battery reconditioner
customer_reviews.text: Float charge and push button to read battery voltage is terrific. It also has 40 amp boost for starting a vehicle. with a low battery. it is better than the other one that was $67.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Jenco

customer_reviews.title: Bought as a gift for my daughter
customer_reviews.text: I used it and it kept shutting off. Tried calling support, unsuccessful I bought two, returned both. I was in the auto service business for 30 years and . never saw a more difficult machine
customer_reviews.author: Frank Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great for those cold mornings
customer_reviews.text: This works great for those cold mornings when the car won't turn over. The quick 90 second charge is usually just enough to get the car rolling. We also love that the charger converts to a trickle charge once the battery reaches a fully charged level.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Competitively priced with a lot of useful features
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so simple to use and operate, I'm a big fan of the digital readout screen as it eliminates guess work. The directions are an easy read but, I did manage to reverse polarity and yes, it does sound a high pitched alarm. I've owned for 11 hours and used it to charge my RV batteries today. I feel it's a worthwhile purchase as it has exceeded my original expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Bayou Blaster

customer_reviews.title: Very good charger
customer_reviews.text: I have used this charger on different vehicles from my motor cycle to my farm tractor. It does a good job of charging and checking the charging system in each vehicle. Its limit is 15 amps max but everytime I have used it did its job.
customer_reviews.author: James Babeshoff

customer_reviews.title: did not work
customer_reviews.text: Should have read the reviews first. The unit, when hooked up to the car battery, kept indicating the cables were disconnected. The ability to start the car did not work. This was returned.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Buy this for capability and peace of mind.
customer_reviews.text: This provides the same charging and jumping capabilities that my father's generation paid large amounts of money for and is much smaller, smarter, and can do more than the models they have. And the modern Black and Decker product line is a challenger for world's best in all they produce.
customer_reviews.author: Russell L Austin, III

customer_reviews.title: Great Item for the Price
customer_reviews.text: in my opinion it's one of the Best Battery Chargers out there .. I have a air cool VW Beetle and a few other items you can't use in the winter { Scooters & Tractors } I use this in the to keep the battery charged and it works every time very happy ... think I had this item now for 2 years
customer_reviews.author: swanzilla

customer_reviews.title: Improved technology at an affordable price. Much better than a manual charger.
customer_reviews.text: The advanced electronics in this unit cycles the power in increments so it doesn't melt the plates in the battery. It will not over=charge the battery and can rejuvenate a neglected battery if it is not too far gone.
customer_reviews.author: Grumpy

customer_reviews.title: Bad product. D0 not buy
customer_reviews.text: Bad. I used one of these about 6 times in 1 1/2 years when it quit working. I then bought another one and it did not work at all.
customer_reviews.author: arlene

customer_reviews.title: 20 Amp charger performs when others don’t suffice
customer_reviews.text: 20 Amp recharger hasn’t let me down. Only negative is lack of detachable / interchangeable alligator clamps Performs when lesser amps won’t
customer_reviews.author: DeeBe

customer_reviews.title: Good Place to throw away $$
customer_reviews.text: Charged my boat cranking battery one time and the it totally quit goy a tech to check it out and he said it was fried and was a total piece of DOG POOP.
customer_reviews.author: El Dano

customer_reviews.title: It works!!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband had a hard time figuring out how it worked. Once someone showed him it has been a great purchase! Not exactly sure why he had a problem it may have been age related. He has used it more then once with no problem!
customer_reviews.author: Charlene Addison

customer_reviews.title: gauge???
customer_reviews.text: had charger on battery many hours gauge never moves above 75 battery warm but when I remove charger battery not charged put brothers charger on same battery and it charged it think I will return would like a charger that will work had one about 30 years bit the dust don't make it now cause last to long china still selling us bad stuff
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customerbug

customer_reviews.title: Awesome way to charge you phone while camping
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE this when we are traveling around and don't know where our next power source will come from. We can keep all the electronics charged.
customer_reviews.author: Shereed

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this brand new to charge the 12 volt battery on my pontoon boat & the trickle charge never shut off. It destroyed the battery completely, and caused $225 in damage and repair. I do not recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Weber

customer_reviews.title: Absolute TRASH
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working almost immediately. Used as instructed. Now it says it is not connected to a battery when it is. TRASH, DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: HowardUdoin

customer_reviews.title: Probably Not Safe To Use Unmonitored.
customer_reviews.text: I'm going to have to give this a one star review because it started smoking pretty badly. It looks good and I wanted to like it, but it didn't perform for either the regular charge over night or the engine start feature. I was willing to blame the battery but after hitting the charge button it started smoking with a bad burning plastic smell. I'm glad I was there to unplug it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Lasted all of three months. Have to return to ...
customer_reviews.text: Lasted all of three months. Have to return to Black & Decker for warranty (good luck with that) since amazon only gives you 30 days. Cheap Chinese junk with a B&D label.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Best Battery Charger EVER!
customer_reviews.text: Not only is it a fast, dependable charger, but it has other great options, such as: battery refresh, which drains then completely recharged your battery And a very helpful Alternator Test. Button so you know if your alternator is working properly AND Engine Start Option which works like a “jump” from a huge engine. Great deal and easy to pack away.
customer_reviews.author: Jade Green

customer_reviews.title: Belly up after 3 years and probably used about 3 times.
customer_reviews.text: Should have lasted longer than this. Piece of junk. Wish I knew a brand That had the quality we got 30 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: gebanks

customer_reviews.title: Some cases you can rejuvenate the battery life by  using the pulsating feature
customer_reviews.text: Keep battery charged and refreshed when not in use for extended period of time and extending the shelf life of the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Floyd

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: If you don't need a huge boost for starting an engine, this is a fine charger. I like the built in handles and the shape sits anywhere around the engine compartment.
customer_reviews.author: H L Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Lots of useful functions and the manual is easy to read and understand. I use it on my UTV, and it works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Trickle charger.
customer_reviews.text: I used it to charge a battery on a Chrysler Sebring overnight in all weather conditions outdoors and it never failed me for years. Buy it if you want a high quality trickle charger that is completely element resistant
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Joe

customer_reviews.title: Big and fast
customer_reviews.text: Bigger than expected but works great I’ve had a 6a black and decker for a while but this is way faster
customer_reviews.author: Tye

customer_reviews.title: Nice Charger!
customer_reviews.text: Great charger. Wish I had bought this sooner. It would have saved me enough money to pay for itself a few times over. Very easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: Matt Nida

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Had to charge my wife’s car battery and this product worked great. Very fast and easy to use. All the cables store away nicely
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: A piece of trash
customer_reviews.text: I tried using it during an emergency, it didn't work even though it was fully charged. Very unfriendly to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had many chargers over the years, the functionality of this one is very impressive. Best one I’ve ever bought.
customer_reviews.author: Curt Hanson

customer_reviews.title: GO CHARGERS! Make Sure it's B&D
customer_reviews.text: OUTSTANDING !!!! This is the best B&D product ever and the best value out there for your money, FOR SURE. Amazing features, like a place to store every thing, clamps and cord. SIMPLE to use and excellent quality, NO QUESTION. Do not hesitate on this perfect charger. It is all you will need at a bargain price. Superb value & a keeper. Could not be happier with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: It keeps reading FLO on a dead battery, I ...
customer_reviews.text: It keeps reading FLO on a dead battery, I first used it on my lawn mower battery, it did not charge it read FLO. So I tryed it on my RV battery and it reads FLO again on it does not have enough charge to turn the RV over.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Very good charger
customer_reviews.text: Good charger and the reconditioning setting really works. Took a battery that hadn't been used for a couple of years and that wouldn't charge to 3 volts and brought it back to life. Reconditioned battery held the charge as well.
customer_reviews.author: Twitchell, PhD Voc Ed

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: I have owned chargers in the past but this charger is the best by far and the price couldn't be more fair.
customer_reviews.author: Frank F.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love it!! This thing was a lifesaver for me when my alt went out. I live in a remote area so not many folks around for a jump start. Got an alt and this from Amazon. All the diagnostic functions on this unit are very easy to operate and understand. Highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: Winston Smith

customer_reviews.title: dint work out of box
customer_reviews.text: Half of display didn't work wouldn't even try to charge any battery i put on it sent it back for refund
customer_reviews.author: tim c

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER BC15BD Fully Automatic 15 Amp 12V Bench Battery Charger/Maintainer with 40A Engine Start, Alternator Check, Cable Clamps
product_meta.description: Size:15 AmpThe BLACK+DECKER BC15BD battery charger and maintainer will get you back on the road in minutes when your vehicle won't start or if your battery needs maintenance. Just connect the battery charger clamps to the battery terminal and press charge. The bench battery charger automatically does the rest for optimum performance. Fully automatic high frequency charging delivers 3 stage charging, automatically switching from fast charge, to top-off, to trickle charge. This bench battery charger is ideal for motorhomes, boats, jet skis, lawn tractors, ATVs, snowmobiles, and vehicles that sit idle for months at a time. Charge and maintain any AGM, GEL, or WET automotive or marine 12 V battery. It's equipped with a digital LCD screen that displays charging status and battery status with easy to understand icons. It also features an alternator check to evaluate the battery voltage under load to indicate if the alternator is maintaining battery level. This battery charger eliminates the need to manually input settings like battery type and size, and charges up to 40 percent faster than other conventional chargers. The BLACK+DECKER BC15BD bench battery charger and maintainer also features a 40 amp engine start, which helps start your vehicle in about 90 seconds for when you need to get back on the road quickly. The built-in cord, cable wrap, and clamp storage make this battery charger easy to use and store. California Energy Commission (CEC) compliant and ETL Certified for performance and safety. Includes a limited 1 year manufacturer warranty.
feature_bullets: 15 amp bench battery charger maintains and charges any AGM, GEL, or WET automotive or marine 12V battery
Fully automatic high frequency charging delivers 3 stage charging, automatically switching from fast charge, to top-off, to trickle charge
Battery reconditioning feature helps extend battery life; 40 amp engine start helps start your vehicle in about 90 seconds
Equipped with reverse polarity protection; LCD screen displays charging status and battery status with easy to understand icons
Features a patented alternator check which indicates if the alternator is maintaining battery level; ETL Certified for performance and safety
